  "article_text": [
    "* theoretical protocol . *",
    "the clifford group is defined as the group of operators that maps the pauli group onto itself under conjugation .",
    "the pauli group is defined as @xcite @xmath2 where @xmath3 , @xmath4 , @xmath5 , and @xmath6 denote the pauli matrices and identity operator , respectively .",
    "the clifford group on @xmath7 qubits is a finite subgroup of the unitary group @xmath8 and can be generated by the hadamard gate @xmath9 , the phase - shift gate @xmath10 , and the controlled - not gate @xmath11 represented as @xmath12 in the computational basis @xmath13 .",
    "an arbitrary one - qubit state can be represented in the bloch sphere as @xmath14 where @xmath15 , @xmath16 and @xmath17 are the three polarization components of the state .",
    "the magic states @xcite are defined as the @xmath18 states with @xmath19 , @xmath20 , @xmath21 ( @xmath22 type ) and the @xmath23 states with @xmath24 , @xmath25 , @xmath26 ; @xmath27 , @xmath26 , @xmath28 ; @xmath29 , @xmath30 , @xmath25 ( @xmath9 type ) .",
    "these states are called  magic  because of their ability , with clifford gates , to enable universal quantum computation and the ability to be purified , when it has been prepared imperfectly , using only clifford group operations @xcite . in our current work we distill an imperfect magic state into a @xmath22-type magic state represented as @xmath31/2 .",
    "\\label{rohgene}\\ ] ] to quantify how near a state @xmath32 is to the magic state , we define the m - polarization ( polarization in the direction of the magic state ) @xmath33 - 1    = \\frac{1}{\\sqrt{3 } } \\left ( p_x + p_y + p_z \\right ) .",
    "\\label{pol}\\ ] ]    the distillation algorithm requires five copies of a faulty magic state @xmath34 as the input state . in the original proposal @xcite , the measurement of four stabilizers @xmath35 ( @xmath36 , ... , @xmath37 )",
    "is applied to @xmath38 , where @xmath39 , @xmath40 , @xmath41 and @xmath42 .",
    "if the outcome of any of these observables is @xmath43 , the state is discarded and the distillation fails .",
    "if the results of all the measurement are @xmath44 , corresponding to the trivial syndrome , one applies the decoding transformation for the five - qubit error correcting code @xcite to the measured state and obtains the output state @xmath45 where @xmath46 has the output m - polarization @xmath47 . if the input m - polarization @xmath48 , distillation is possible and @xmath49 and produces a state nearer to the magic one . in an iterative manner ,",
    "it is possible to obtain the output m - polarization approaching @xmath50 .    as nmr qip",
    "is implemented in an ensemble of spin systems , only the output of expectation values of ensemble measurements @xcite are available .",
    "consequently the above projective measurement of the stabilizers can not be implemented in our experiment . however , as the decoding operation is just a basis transformation from one stabilizer subspace to another , it is possible to evaluate the result of the distillation after decoding .",
    "therefore , we directly apply the decoding operation to the input state @xmath38 , and the output state becomes a statistical mixture of 16 possible outcomes represented as @xmath51 where @xmath52 is the probability of each outcome , and @xmath53 , @xmath54 , ... ,",
    "@xmath55 , for @xmath56 , @xmath50 , @xmath57 , ... ,",
    "@xmath58 , noting @xmath59 . now measuring @xmath0 on all four qubits in @xmath60 indicates a successful purification .",
    "we can obtain @xmath52 and @xmath61 using partial quantum state tomography @xcite .",
    "* experimental results . *",
    "the data were taken with a bruker 700 mhz spectrometer .",
    "we choose @xmath62c- labelled trans - crotonic acid dissolved in d6-acetone as a seven - qubit register .",
    "the structure of the molecule and the parameters of qubits are shown in table [ mol ] .",
    "we prepare a labelled pseudo - pure state @xmath63 using the method in ref .",
    "@xcite , where @xmath64 and the order of qubits is m , h@xmath65 , h@xmath66 , c@xmath65 , c@xmath66 , c@xmath67 , c@xmath68 .",
    "one should note that we are using the deviation density matrix formalism .",
    "we prepare an initial imperfect magic state with three equal polarization components by depolarizing the state @xmath69 .",
    "first we apply a @xmath70 pulse to rotate the state @xmath71 to @xmath72 and then another @xmath70 pulse along direction @xmath73 $ ] is applied .",
    "we use phase cycling to average the @xmath74- and @xmath75- components of the state to zero , and therefore the polarization of the spin initially in the state @xmath71 is reduced .",
    "the depolarized state is represented as @xmath76 finally we apply a rotation with angle @xmath77 about the direction @xmath78 $ ] to obtain an imperfect magic state @xmath79/2\\ ] ] where @xmath80 . the evolution of @xmath5 in the preparing @xmath32 is shown in fig .",
    "[ bloch ] . by doing the above operation for qubits m ,",
    "c@xmath65 , c@xmath66 , c@xmath67 , c@xmath68 , respectively , we obtain five copies of the imperfect magic states @xmath81 .",
    "exploiting partial state tomography , we measure @xmath82 for each qubit and use the average as the input m - polarization @xmath83 for @xmath38 .    the circuit for the distillation operation is shown in fig .",
    "c@xmath65 carries the distilled state after the distillation . with partial state tomography",
    ", we can determine @xmath52 and @xmath84 in equation ( [ dists ] ) , where @xmath85 , from which the output m - polarization @xmath47 is obtained . the experimental results for magic state distillation for various @xmath83 are shown in fig . [ poldist ] , where figures ( a ) and ( b ) show the measured @xmath47 and @xmath86 , respectively .",
    "the straight line in figure ( a ) represents the function @xmath87 .",
    "the data points above the line show the states that have been distilled experimentally .",
    "the implementation time of the distillation procedure is about 0.1 s , a non - negligible amount of time ( 10% ) compared to coherence time ( @xmath88 in table [ mol ] ) .",
    "hence the decay of the signals due to the limitation of coherence time is an important source of errors .",
    "we extract @xmath47 by measuring the ratio of @xmath89 and @xmath86 , where these two factors are obtained by various single coherent terms in a series of experiments ( see details in methods ) .",
    "we have assumed that the terms have the same amount of decoherence .",
    "the results of simulations with dephasing rates @xmath90 and @xmath91 are shown in fig .",
    "[ poldist ] as the blue squares and red triangles .",
    "the simulation results show that the decoherence rates are long enough to allow the distillation and suggest that the deviation of @xmath92 from the theoretical expectation can be mainly attributed to relaxation effects .",
    "additionally , imperfection in the shaped pulses and inhomogeneities of magnetic fields also contribute to errors .",
    "we modify the original distillation protocol by avoiding the projective measurement , which is not possible to implement in the nmr qip s .",
    "we exploit partial - state tomography to obtain each output in the mixture of the outcomes after the distillation , and only in a post - processing step do we choose the one we need .",
    "although we could access the @xmath93 subspace using a procedure similar to the pseudo - pure state preparation , the method would take a substantially longer amount of time and would be more error - prone . in this work we aim for a quantitative result , i.e. increasing the magic state purity .",
    "we need to minimize the readout manipulations to avoid control - error induced distortions of the inferred final state and associated purity .",
    "hence , we limited ourselves to simple high - fidelity readout procedures .    in summary , we have implemented a protocol for distilling magic states based on the five qubit quantum error correction code .",
    "we exploit five qubits by controlling a seven - qubit nmr quantum information processor .",
    "the experiment shows that we have obtained enough control to purify faulty magic states through distillation .",
    "* overview of the experiment . * to implement the experiment",
    ", we exploit standard isech and hermite - shaped pulses as well as numerically optimized grape pulses @xcite to implement single - spin operations .",
    "the grape pulses are optimized to be robust to radio frequency ( r.f . )",
    "inhomogeneities and chemical shift variations .",
    "all pulses are combined in a custom - built software compiler @xcite .",
    "the compiler loads the information about the internal hamiltonian and the desired unitary transformation from simple predefined building blocks .",
    "the blocks are then systematically put together to form a pulse sequence ensuring that the errors in the building blocks do not propagate as the sequence progresses .",
    "* r.f . selection .",
    "* the effect of pulse imperfections due to r.f .",
    "inhomogeneities is reduced by selecting signal based on r.f .",
    "power @xcite .",
    "the signal selection is achieved by spatially selecting molecules from a small region in the sample .",
    "the method is similar to imaging methods @xcite and has been used in previous works @xcite .",
    "here we substitute the original pulse sequence proposed in ref.@xcite by a single grape pulse to optimize the performance . besides reducing r.f inhomogeneities ,",
    "the spatial selection of spins can also reduce the static field inhomogeneities and therefore reduces the loss of signal during the experiment .",
    "we have found that the effective relaxation time ( @xmath94 ) of spins after the r.f .",
    "selection increases significantly , e.g. , up to a factor 2 for some spins .    * partial state tomography .",
    "* we use the spectra obtained from the labelled pseudo - pure state @xmath63 shown in fig .",
    "[ ppsfig ] as a phase reference and to normalize the signals in c@xmath65 and c@xmath66 spectra , for measuring the initial and output m - polarization . to obtain the reduced density matrix of c@xmath65 through the partial state tomography , we expand equation ( [ dists ] ) as a sum of product operators @xcite , and represent @xmath61 as @xmath95 in the expansion there are 128 terms that are required to determine by the experiment .",
    "the coefficients of such expansion can be directly related to the measurable spectral amplitudes @xcite .",
    "on the other hand , such coefficients can also be related to the relevant parameters of ( [ dists ] ) , i.e , @xmath96 , @xmath97 , @xmath98 and @xmath52 for @xmath56 , @xmath50 , @xmath57 , ... , @xmath58 .",
    "the relation between these parameters and the nmr observables can be expressed by the set of linear equations @xmath99 the @xmath100 element , @xmath101 , of the column vector @xmath102 is the coefficient related to the operator @xmath103 with the order of qubits @xmath104 , h@xmath65 , h@xmath66 , c@xmath65 , c@xmath66 , c@xmath67 , c@xmath68 , where @xmath105 can be one element of the pauli group @xmath106 and the vector @xmath107 is the four digit binary representation of the integer @xmath108 . for @xmath109 , @xmath4 , @xmath5 , and @xmath110 , @xmath111 , @xmath112 , @xmath113 and @xmath114 , respectively .",
    "the elements of the matrix @xmath115 are given by @xmath116    providing that we have all necessary coefficients measured , we can reconstruct the distilled states using the following approach .",
    "first , we fit the nmr spectral lines to the yield complex amplitudes for measuring all necessary coefficients @xcite . fig .",
    "[ spectra ] illustrates the spectra of c@xmath65 after the completion of distillation for @xmath117 , where the experimentally measured , fitted , and ideal spectra are shown as the red , black , and blue curves , respectively .",
    "then the state ( [ dists ] ) is reconstructed by solving the set of equations ( [ seteq ] ) .",
    "our calculation shows that four readout operations are sufficient to determine all coefficients : first , read out on c@xmath65 ; second , read out on c@xmath65 after the application of a @xmath118 pulse ; third , read out on c@xmath66 after the application of a @xmath119 pulse ; and forth , read out on c@xmath66 after a polarization transfer from h@xmath65 to c@xmath66 .",
    "the last two readout operations are sufficient to measure all @xmath52 , and the first two are used to measure @xmath120 .",
    "the errors for the coefficients , as well errors for @xmath96 , @xmath97 , @xmath98 and @xmath52 , are estimated from the uncertainty of the fitting parameters . the measured initial and output m - polarization , as well as @xmath52 and @xmath84 ,",
    "are listed as supplementary tables s1-s10 in the supplementary information @xcite .",
    "the comparison of the various measured @xmath121 with the theory is shown as equations ( 1 - 7 ) in the supplementary methods in the supplementary information .",

    ".*characteristics of the molecule of trans - crotonic acid .",
    "* molecular structure is shown as fig .",
    "[ crot7 ] .",
    "the chemical shifts and j - coupling constants ( in hz ) are on and below the diagonal in the table , respectively .",
    "the transversal relaxation times @xmath91 measured by a hahn echo and @xmath90 calculated by measuring the width of the peaks through fitting the spectra are listed at the bottom .",
    "the chemical shifts are given with respect to reference frequencies of 700.13 mhz ( protons ) and 176.05 mhz ( carbons ) .",
    "the molecule contains nine weakly coupled spin half nuclei but consists of a seven qubit system since the methyl group can be treated as a single qubit using a gradient - based subspace selection @xcite .",
    "[ cols=\"^,^,^,^,^,^,^,^ \" , ]      in the preparation of a faulty magic state in bloch sphere , where arrows represent the states of the qubit . * * a * , a @xmath70 rotation along y - axis transforms @xmath5 ( blue ) to @xmath3 ( green ) . *",
    "b * , another @xmath70 rotation along direction @xmath123 $ ] transforms @xmath3 ( green ) to @xmath124 ( black ) . in phase cycling",
    "we apply the second @xmath70 rotation by changing @xmath125 to @xmath126 to transform @xmath3 to @xmath127 . after averaging the @xmath74- and @xmath75- components to zero",
    ", the polarization is reduced to @xmath128 , shown as the yellow arrow in figure * c * , noting that @xmath129 $ ] . * d * , a final rotation with angle @xmath130 along @xmath78 $ ] transforms @xmath128 ( yellow ) to @xmath131 ( red).,width=340 ]    , @xmath132 , and @xmath133 .",
    "qubits labelled as m , c@xmath65 , c@xmath66 , c@xmath67 and c@xmath68 are used to encode the five copies of the initial state .",
    "due to the nature of the algorithm , the carbon c@xmath65 contains the distilled magic state only when m , c@xmath66 , c@xmath67 and c@xmath68 are in the @xmath134 state .",
    "it is important to emphasize that all gates are clifford gates .",
    "the refocussing pulses ( which also decouple @xmath135 and @xmath136 ) are not shown.,width=529 ]     ( * b * ) of finding this state in the mixture of outcomes [ see equation ( [ dists ] ) ] as a function of the input m - polarization of the initial faulty magic state .",
    "the experimental data are represented by the filled circles and the error bars are estimated from the uncertainty of the fitting parameters .",
    "the line in figure ( a ) represents the function @xmath137 .",
    "the experimental points above the line show the states that have been distilled , while the points below the line show the states that can not be distilled in the protocol .",
    "the theoretical prediction is represented by the black solid curves .",
    "the blue squares and red triangles , connected by dashed lines for visual convenience , are the simulation results where the dephasing rates are chosen as @xmath138 and @xmath88 ( see table [ mol ] ) , respectively .",
    "the effective @xmath91 during the experiment should be similar to the hahn echo @xmath91 .",
    "the deviation can be attributed to other error sources ( see text ) .",
    "the dephasing times of h@xmath139 and h@xmath140 actually do not influence the results because h@xmath139 and h@xmath140 can be effectively assumed in @xmath71 and @xmath141 during the whole experiment , respectively .",
    ", width=453 ]       after the completion of distillation for @xmath117 . *",
    "the spectra are divided in four different parts shown as figures ( * a - d * ) for better visualization .",
    "the vertical axes have arbitrary but the same units .",
    "the experimentally measured , fitting , and ideal spectra are shown as the red , black , and blue curves , respectively .",
    ", width=642 ]"
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> any physical quantum device for quantum information processing is subject to errors in implementation . in order to be reliable and efficient , quantum computers will need error correcting or error avoiding methods . </S>",
    "<S> fault - tolerance achieved through quantum error correction will be an integral part of quantum computers . </S>",
    "<S> of the many methods that have been discovered to implement it , a highly successful approach has been to use transversal gates and specific initial states . a critical element for its implementation </S>",
    "<S> is the availability of high - fidelity initial states such as @xmath0 and the _ magic state_. here we report an experiment , performed in a nuclear magnetic resonance ( nmr ) quantum processor , showing sufficient quantum control to improve the fidelity of imperfect initial magic states by distilling five of them into one with higher fidelity .    </S>",
    "<S> institute for quantum computing and department of physics and astronomy , university of waterloo , waterloo , canada , on n2l 3g1 .    </S>",
    "<S> perimeter institute for theoretical physics , waterloo , canada , on n2j 2w9 .    quantum information processing ( qip ) @xcite promises a dramatic computational speed - up over classical computers for certain problems . in implementation , </S>",
    "<S> the physical quantum devices for qip are subject to errors due to the effects of unwanted interactions with the environment or quantum control imperfections . in order to be reliable and efficient </S>",
    "<S> , quantum computers will need error correcting or error avoiding methods . </S>",
    "<S> one method to achieve fault - tolerant quantum computation is to encode the state of a single quantum bit ( qubit ) into blocks of several qubits that are more robust to errors . </S>",
    "<S> based on this idea , quantum error correction codes , the theory of fault - tolerant quantum computation and the accuracy threshold theorem have been developed @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> a key element for fault - tolerant quantum computation is to avoid bad error propagation . </S>",
    "<S> one straightforward protocol is to use transversal gates where an error occurring on the @xmath1th qubit in one block can only propagate to the @xmath1th qubit in the other blocks . a highly successful approach to achieve fault - tolerant universal quantum computation </S>",
    "<S> is based on quantum error correcting codes with gates from the clifford group that can be applied transversally @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> unfortunately they are not universal @xcite and they must be supplemented with the preparation of not only the @xmath0 state but also another type of state such as a _ magic state _ @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> thus , a critical element for fault - tolerance is the availability of high - fidelity magic states . </S>",
    "<S> consequently , in the pursuit of experimental fault - tolerant quantum computation , it is important to determine whether we have sufficient experimental control to prepare these magic states . </S>",
    "<S> in general these will be prepared with some imprecision . </S>",
    "<S> the states can be improved by distilling many magic states to produce a fewer number of them which have higher fidelity . </S>",
    "<S> here we report an experiment , performed in a seven - qubit nuclear magnetic resonance ( nmr ) quantum processor , showing sufficient quantum control to implement a distillation protocol based on the five - bit quantum error correcting code @xcite which uses only clifford gates . </S>",
    "<S> the fidelity of imperfect initial magic states is improved by distilling five of them into one with higher fidelity . </S>"
  ]
}
